pages.title: Accounts in Asset Hub Smart Contracts
pages.description: Bridges Ethereum's 20-byte addresses with Polkadot's 32-byte accounts, enabling seamless interaction while maintaining compatibility with Ethereum tooling.

pages.title: Add a Pallet to the Runtime
pages.description: Learn how to include and configure pallets in a Polkadot SDK-based runtime, from adding dependencies to implementing necessary traits.

pages.title: Add Multiple Pallet Instances
pages.description: Learn how to implement multiple instances of the same pallet in your Polkadot SDK-based runtime to create and interact with modular blockchain components.

pages.title: Add Pallets to the Runtime
pages.description: Add pallets to your runtime for custom functionality. Learn to configure and integrate pallets in Polkadot SDK-based blockchains.

pages.title: Add Smart Contract Functionality
pages.description: Add smart contract capabilities to your Polkadot SDK-based blockchain. Explore EVM and Wasm integration for enhanced chain functionality.

pages.title: Asset Transfer API
pages.description: Asset Transfer API is a library that simplifies the transfer of assets for Polkadot SDK-based chains. It provides methods for cross-chain and local transfers.

pages.title: Asset Transfer API Reference
pages.description: Explore the Asset Transfer API Reference for comprehensive details on methods, data types, and functionalities. Essential for cross-chain asset transfers.

pages.title: Benchmarking FRAME Pallets
pages.description: Learn how to use FRAME's benchmarking framework to measure extrinsic execution costs and provide accurate weights for on-chain computations.

pages.title: Blocks
pages.description: Understand how blocks are produced, validated, and imported in Polkadot SDK-based blockchains, covering initialization, finalization, and authoring processes.

pages.title: Build a Custom Pallet
pages.description: Learn how to build a custom pallet for Polkadot SDK-based blockchains with this step-by-step guide. Create and configure a simple counter pallet from scratch.

pages.title: Build a deterministic runtime
pages.description: Explains how to use the Polkadot SDK runtime toolbox and Docker to build deterministic Wasm binaries for Polkadot SDK-based chains.

pages.title: Chain Data
pages.description: Learn how to expose and utilize chain data for blockchain applications. Discover runtime metadata, RPC APIs, and tools for efficient development.

pages.title: Coretime Renewal
pages.description: Learn how to renew coretime manually or automatically to ensure uninterrupted parachain operation with predictable pricing and minimal risk.

pages.title: Create a Smart Contract
pages.description: Learn how to write a basic smart contract using just a text editor. This guide covers creating and preparing a contract for deployment on Polkadot Hub.

pages.title: Cryptography
pages.description: A concise guide to cryptography in blockchain, covering hash functions, encryption types, digital signatures, and elliptic curve applications.

pages.title: Data Encoding
pages.description: SCALE codec enables fast, efficient data encoding, ideal for resource-constrained environments like Wasm, supporting custom types and compact encoding.

pages.title: Deploy an ERC-20 to Polkadot Hub
pages.description: Deploy an ERC-20 token on Polkadot Hub using PolkaVM. This guide covers contract creation, compilation, deployment, and interaction via Polkadot Remix IDE.

pages.title: Deploy an NFT to Polkadot Hub
pages.description: Deploy an NFT on Polkadot Hub using PolkaVM and OpenZeppelin. Learn how to compile, deploy, and interact with your contract using Polkadot Remix IDE.

pages.title: Deploy on Paseo TestNet
pages.description: This guide walks you through the journey of deploying your Polkadot SDK blockchain on Paseo, detailing each step to a successful TestNet deployment.

pages.title: E2E Testing with Moonwall
pages.description: Enhance blockchain end-to-end testing with Moonwall's standardized environment setup, comprehensive configuration management, and simple network interactions.

pages.title: EVM vs PolkaVM
pages.description: Compares EVM and PolkaVM, highlighting key architectural differences, gas models, memory management, and account handling while ensuring Solidity compatibility.

pages.title: Fork a Chain with Chopsticks
pages.description: Learn how to fork live Polkadot SDK chains with Chopsticks. Configure forks, replay blocks, test XCM, and interact programmatically or via UI.

pages.title: Generate Chain Specs
pages.description: Describes the role of the chain specification in a network, how to specify its parameters when starting a node, and how to customize and distribute it.

pages.title: Get Started
pages.description: Simplify Polkadot SDK development with Chopsticks. Learn essential features, how to install Chopsticks, and how to configure local blockchain forks.

pages.title: Get Started
pages.description: Quickly install and configure Zombienet to deploy and test Polkadot-based blockchain networks with this comprehensive getting-started guide.

pages.title: Glossary
pages.description: Glossary of terms used within the Polkadot ecosystem, Polkadot SDK, its subsequent libraries, and other relevant Web3 terminology.

pages.title: Install Polkadot SDK Dependencies
pages.description: Install everything you need to begin working with Substrated-based blockchains and the Polkadot SDK, the framework for building blockchains.

pages.title: Interoperability
pages.description: Explore the importance of interoperability in the Polkadot ecosystem, covering XCM, bridges, and cross-chain communication.

pages.title: Introduction to Polkadot SDK
pages.description: Learn about the Polkadot SDK, a robust developer toolkit for building custom blockchains. Explore its components and how it powers the Polkadot protocol.

pages.title: Introduction to XCM
pages.description: Unlock blockchain interoperability with XCM — Polkadot's Cross-Consensus Messaging format for cross-chain interactions.

pages.title: JSON-RPC APIs
pages.description: JSON-RPC APIs guide for Polkadot Hub, covering supported methods, parameters, and examples for interacting with the chain.

pages.title: Make a Custom Pallet
pages.description: Learn how to create custom pallets using FRAME, allowing for flexible, modular, and scalable blockchain development. Follow the step-by-step guide.

pages.title: Manage Coretime
pages.description: Learn to manage bulk coretime regions through transfer, partition, interlace, assign, and pool operations for optimal resource allocation.

pages.title: Mock Runtime for Pallet Testing
pages.description: Learn to create a mock environment in the Polkadot SDK for testing intra-pallet functionality and inter-pallet interactions seamlessly.

pages.title: Networks
pages.description: Explore the Polkadot ecosystem networks and learn the unique purposes of each, tailored for blockchain innovation, testing, and enterprise-grade solutions.

pages.title: Networks
pages.description: Explore Polkadot's testing and production networks, including Westend, Kusama, and Paseo, for efficient development, deployment, and testing.

pages.title: Networks for Polkadot Hub Smart Contracts
pages.description: Explore the available networks for smart contract development on Polkadot Hub, including Westend Hub, Kusama Hub, and Polkadot Hub.

pages.title: Node and Runtime
pages.description: Learn how Polkadot SDK-based nodes function, how the client and runtime are separated, and how they communicate using SCALE-encoded data.

pages.title: Obtain Coretime
pages.description: Learn how to obtain and manage coretime for your Polkadot parachain. Explore bulk and on-demand options, prerequisites, and initial setup.

pages.title: Obtain Coretime
pages.description: Learn how to obtain coretime for block production with this guide, covering both on-demand and bulk options for smooth operations.

pages.title: On-Chain Governance Overview
pages.description: Discover Polkadot’s cutting-edge OpenGov system, enabling transparent, decentralized decision-making through direct democracy and flexible governance tracks.

pages.title: Opening HRMP Channels Between Parachains
pages.description: Learn how to open HRMP channels between parachains on Polkadot. Discover the step-by-step process for establishing uni- and bidirectional communication.

pages.title: Opening HRMP Channels with System Parachains
pages.description: Learn how to open HRMP channels with Polkadot system parachains. Discover the process for establishing bi-directional communication using a single XCM message.

pages.title: Overview
pages.description: Learn about the role, functionality, and implementation of parachains as a developer in the wider Polkadot architecture.

pages.title: Overview of FRAME
pages.description: Learn how Polkadot SDK’s FRAME framework simplifies blockchain development with modular pallets and support libraries for efficient runtime design.

pages.title: Overview of Polkadot's System Chains
pages.description: Discover how system parachains enhance Polkadot's scalability and performance by offloading tasks like governance, asset management, and bridging from the relay chain.

pages.title: Overview of the Polkadot Relay Chain
pages.description: Explore Polkadot's core architecture, including its multi-chain vision, shared security, and the DOT token's governance and staking roles.

pages.title: Pallet Benchmarking
pages.description: Learn how to benchmark Polkadot SDK-based pallets, assigning precise weights to extrinsics for accurate fee calculation and runtime optimization.

pages.title: Pallet Testing
pages.description: Learn how to efficiently test pallets in the Polkadot SDK, ensuring the reliability and security of your pallets operations.

pages.title: Pallet Unit Testing
pages.description: Discover how to create thorough unit tests for pallets built with the Polkadot SDK, using a custom pallet as a practical example.

pages.title: Parachain Consensus
pages.description: Understand how the blocks authored by parachain collators are secured by the relay chain validators and how the parachain transactions achieve finality.

pages.title: Polkadot Omni Node
pages.description: Run parachain nodes easily with the polkadot-omni-node, a white-labeled binary that can run parachain nodes using a single pre-built solution.

pages.title: Polkadot SDK Accounts
pages.description: Learn about account structures, balances, and address formats in the Polkadot SDK, including how to manage lifecycle, references, and balances.

pages.title: PolkaVM Design
pages.description: Discover PolkaVM, a high-performance smart contract VM for Polkadot, enabling Ethereum compatibility via pallet_revive, Solidity support & optimized execution.

pages.title: Quickstart Parachain Development with Pop CLI
pages.description: Quickly bootstrap parachain projects, scaffold templates, deploy local networks, and streamline development workflows using Pop CLI.

pages.title: Randomness
pages.description: Explore the importance of randomness in PoS blockchains, focusing on Polkadot’s VRF-based approach to ensure fairness and security in validator selection.

pages.title: Register a Local Asset
pages.description: Comprehensive guide to registering a local asset on the Asset Hub system parachain, including step-by-step instructions.

pages.title: Runtime Metrics and Monitoring
pages.description: Learn how to monitor and visualize node performance in Polkadot SDK-based networks using telemetry, Prometheus, and Grafana for efficient runtime monitoring.

pages.title: Runtime Upgrades
pages.description: This page covers how runtime versioning and storage migration support forkless upgrades for Polkadot SDK-based networks and how they factor into chain upgrades.

pages.title: Send XCM Messages
pages.description: Send cross-chain messages using XCM, Polkadot's Cross-Consensus Messaging format, designed to support secure communication between chains.

pages.title: Set Up a Template
pages.description: Learn to compile and run a local parachain node using Polkadot SDK. Launch, run, and interact with a pre-configured runtime template.

pages.title: Smart Contracts Basics Overview
pages.description: Learn how developers can build smart contracts on Polkadot by leveraging either Wasm/ink! or EVM contracts across many parachains.

pages.title: Smart Contracts Overview
pages.description: Learn about smart contract development capabilities in the Polkadot ecosystem, either by leveraging Polkadot Hub or other alternatives.

pages.title: Spawn a Basic Chain with Zombienet
pages.description: Learn to spawn, connect to and monitor a basic blockchain network with Zombienet, using customizable configurations for streamlined development and debugging.

pages.title: Storage Migrations
pages.description: Ensure smooth runtime upgrades with storage migrations, update data formats, and prevent errors. Learn when and how to implement migrations efficiently.

pages.title: Testing and Debugging
pages.description: Learn how to test and debug cross-chain communication via the XCM Emulator to ensure interoperability and reliable execution.

pages.title: Transactions
pages.description: Learn how to construct, submit, and validate transactions in the Polkadot SDK, covering signed, unsigned, and inherent types of transactions.

pages.title: Transactions and Fees on Asset Hub
pages.description: Explore how Asset Hub smart contracts handle blocks, transactions, and fees with EVM compatibility, supporting various Ethereum transaction types.

pages.title: Transactions Weights and Fees
pages.description: Overview of transaction weights and fees in Polkadot SDK chains, detailing how fees are calculated using a defined formula and runtime specifics.

pages.title: Unlock a Parachain
pages.description: Learn how to unlock your parachain. This step-by-step guide covers verifying lock status, preparing calls, and executing the unlock process.

pages.title: Write Tests
pages.description: Write and execute tests for blockchain networks with Zombienet's DSL. Learn to evaluate metrics, logs, events, and more for robust validation.

pages.title: XCM Channels
pages.description: Learn how Polkadot's cross-consensus messaging (XCM) channels connect parachains, facilitating communication and blockchain interaction.

pages.title: XCM Config
pages.description: Learn how the XCM Executor configuration works for your custom Polkadot SDK-based runtime with detailed guidance and references.

pages.title: XCM Runtime APIs
pages.description: Learn about XCM Runtime APIs in Polkadot for cross-chain communication. Explore the APIs to simulate and test XCM messages before execution on the network.

pages.title: XCM Tools
pages.description: Explore essential XCM tools across Polkadot, crafted to enhance cross-chain functionality and integration within the ecosystem.

pages.title: XCM Transfers from Relay Chain to Parachain
pages.description: Learn how to perform a reserve-backed asset transfer between a relay chain and a parachain using XCM for cross-chain interoperability.
